frameDefinitions: An Owner has (or lacks) a Possession. '' 'The river's part of my  manor, but of course it also belongs to the River Police.'
These are words describing a basic commercial transaction involving a Buyer and a Seller exchanging Money and Goods, taking the perspective of the Buyer.
Unless a particular Required_situation obtains, Negative_consequences will follow.
A speaker marks a Conceded_state_of_affairs as being or implying a contradiction to the Main_assertion.
An Entity meets the pre-conditions for participating in an Event.
The speaker believes that some state of affairs or entity (the Requirement) must be present in order to cause some other dependent state of affairs to occur (the Dependent).
frameExamples: The river's part of my  manor, but of course it also <t>belongs</t> to the River Police.
Abby bought a car from Robin for $5,000.
You <t>must</t> turn in your test by 5 p.m.
<t>Although</t> she had some trouble , she was able to finish about two hours early .
Conductor software gives us the hands-on <t>capability</t> to provide updates immediately
listRoleDefinitions: The entity that owns a posession.

The thing which is owned by the Owner.
Ex.:  I <t>have</t> <fex name='Possession'>twenty bucks</fex>.
(This does not include bodyparts or medical conditions, but does include intellectual property, etc.)
This role indicates the <fen>Time</fen> interval during which the <fen>Owner</fen> has a possession.
The <fen>Buyer</fen> wants the <fen>Goods</fen> and offers <fen>Money</fen> to a <fen>Seller</fen> in exchange for them.
The role <fen>Goods</fen> is anything (including labor or time, for example) which is exchanged for <fen>Money</fen> in a transaction.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The state-of-affairs which prevents <fen>Negative_consequences</fen>.
The period during which the <fen>Required_situation</fen> is necessary to prevent negative consequences.
The location within which the <fen>Required_situation</fen> is required.

A proposition or set of propositions that the speaker wants the addressee to believe or take for granted. This statement is not asserted, but presupposed by the speaker of the sentence, and is mentioned to contrast with the <fen>Main_assertion</fen>. It would or could seem to predict a situation different than the <fen>Main_assertion</fen>, but, for reasons left implicit, this normal prediction is contradicted by the fact that the <fen>Main_assertion</fen> and the <fen>Conceded_state_of_affairs</fen> are both simultaneously true.
An entity which metonymically stands in for an associated <fen>Statement</fen>.

The statement that the speaker wishes to assert or offer as their main contribution to the discourse, which is be modified or hedged in some way by the <fen>Conceded_state_of_affairs</fen>. The force of the contribution of the <fen>Main_assertion</fen> is presented as undiluted by the fact that something different from the <fen>Main_assertion</fen> would normally by predicted, based on the facts in the <fen>Conceded_state_of_affairs</fen>.
The <fen>Entity</fen> whose meeting or falling short of pre-conditions is assessed.
The <fen>Event</fen> that the <fen>Entity</fen> may participate in.
The time at which the <fen>Entity</fen> is capable of the <fen>Event</fen>.
The Cognizer requires or believes he/she requires the Requirement to hold so that the Dependent will occur.
The entity or state-of-affairs that must be present or obtain in order for the Dependent to obtain.
The state-of-affairs which cannot hold without the <fen>Requirement</fen>.
An undesirable state-of-affairs that results if the <fen>Requirement</fen> is not met.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> requires the <fen>Requirement</fen>.
The location of the <fen>Cognizer</fen> when he/she requires the <fen>Requirement</fen>.
listRoleExamples: He was told that <fex>when he got back</fex> , his column needed a serious rethink .
<fex>In California</fex> , seatbelts must be fastened at all times .
She got married in spite of <fex>him</fex> .
White House voices doubts about Aristide's ability <fex>to govern</fex>
He needs to focus on his schoolwork, <fex>or he's not going to pass the third grade</fex>.
<fex>Over at Merv's house</fex> they need three more cement trucks to finish the job.

passageCandidateSpans.text: The National Commission on Terrorist Attacks

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the middle of the election season
